questions.text: What is the name of the maneuver used during the treatment of shoulder dystocia during labour in which the patient is positioned in knee-hand position?
A 27 years old G2P1L1 with 10 weeks of gestation has Rh negative pregnancy. Her partner’s blood group is Rh negative. She has undergone MTP. How much amount of Anti-D must be given to the patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. No need of inj. Anti-D

questions.text: A 28 years old G3P2L2 with 9 months of pregnancy has come to the ANC OPD with history of last delivery 4 years ago. She took inj. dT in her last pregnancy. How many doses of inj. dT must be given to her in this pregnancy as per govt. of INDIA?
A primigravida delivered a full-term baby. In the third stage of labour while doing controlled cord traction, there was cord avulsion. What should be the next line of management in this case?

options.label: D
options.text: Use ovum forceps to deliver the placenta

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions is not the cause of recurrent second trimester pregnancy losses?
A gynecologist has stated the procedure of laparoscopic tubal ligation. Which of the following is the best site of doing the tubal ligation?
Arrange the following in the sequence of occurrence during fertilization: 1) Acrosomal reaction 2) Binding to Zona pellucida 3) Capacitation 4) Zona reaction

True or false (about organogenesis) 1) Meiosis 1----------------------------> gets over at fertilization 2) Meiosis 2-----------------------------> gets over at ovulation 3) Arrest of M1-----------------------> occurs at puberty 4) Arrest of M2 ----------------------> occurs in metaphase
Which one of the following is true about injectable iron therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: Ferric carboxymaltose dose limit is 200mg per day

options.label: B
options.text: Iron sucrose can be given intramuscularly

options.label: C
options.text: Injectable iron and oral iron therapy together will increase the Hb faster than any solo method

options.label: D
options.text: Injectable iron therapy is indicated in severe anemia in early third trimester

questions.correct_answer: D. Injectable iron therapy is indicated in severe anemia in early third trimester

questions.text: A 32 years old primigravida has 3 months of gestation. She has history of bleeding per vaginum since last 2 days. Which one of the following is not the cause of bleeding in this case?
A 26 years old primigravida has an intra uterine partial molar pregnancy. Which of the following is not seen in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Karyotype of the products of conception would be 46XX

options.label: C
options.text: Most common clinical feature is vaginal bleeding

options.label: D
options.text: It has less risk of malignant transformation than complete mole.

questions.correct_answer: A. Karyotype of the products of conception would be 46XX

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about screening of Down’s syndrome in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Quadruple test is made up of free B-HCG, AFP, UE3 and inhibin A

options.label: B
options.text: PAPP-A is used in first trimester screening

options.label: C
options.text: Nuchal Translucency scan in first trimester has a critical cut off of 3mm

options.label: D
options.text: Combined test of first trimester is more sensitive than NIPT.

questions.correct_answer: D. Combined test of first trimester is more sensitive than NIPT.

questions.text: A 32 years old G2P1L1 has 32 weeks of gestation. On clinical examination, Leopold 3 grip was found to be empty. Usg ruled out fetal and uterine anomalies. Which of the following is the next best line of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Do an external cephalic version and wait for spontaneous labour

options.label: C
options.text: Do an external cephalic version and induce labour

options.label: D
options.text: Do an elective LSCS at term

questions.text: Which of the following is not a sign of placental separation?
A 36 years old G3P2L2 has 38 weeks of gestation has undergone MRI and this image was obtained. Which of the following is true about this case?

options.label: A
options.text: If the fetus is dead then vaginal delivery must be attempted

options.label: B
options.text: If patient has no symptoms and fetus is having no distress then we must continue this pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Tocolytics must be given if the uterus starts contracting

questions.correct_answer: D. LSCS must be done now

questions.text: A 27 years old primigravida has 16 weeks of gestation. On USG, the cervical length was found to be 2.2cm but the internal os was closed. There were no fetal anomalies seen. What should be the next line of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Give progesterone support till term + do cervical cerclage immediately

options.label: C
options.text: Wait and watch with monthly USG

questions.correct_answer: A. Give progesterone support till term

questions.text: A 23 years old primigravida has a gestation of 38 weeks. Since last 2 hours, she is leaking amniotic fluid per vaginum. She has no uterine contractions; the fetus is in vertex presentation and her pelvis is adequate in size. Which one of the following is not useful in the management of this case?
A multigravida patient has delivered twin babies. The placenta showed dividing septum made up of 2 layers. What is the type of twin delivered?
Which of the following is not a sign of toxicity of MgSO4 in a patient of eclampsia?
Which one of the following is not fitting in the criteria for the diagnosis of overt DM in pregnancy?
Which of the following changes in pregnancy would be considered as pathological?
Which of the following is not the feature of progesterone in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: It has a tocolytic action on uterine musculature

options.label: B
options.text: It leads to proliferation of alveoli in breasts

options.label: D
options.text: It makes the cervical mucous hostile for the entry of the sperms.

questions.correct_answer: C. It increases thyroid binding globulins

questions.text: What should be the management of the following case in labour?
Which one of the following is the most common cause of malposition in labour?
A woman was found to be HIV positive in first trimester and when should ART to be started?

options.label: A
options.text: Start ART in second trimester and continue life long

options.label: B
options.text: Start ART immediately and continue life long

options.label: C
options.text: Start ART immediately and stop after delivery

options.label: D
options.text: Start ART in second trimester and continue till 6 months of delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. Start ART immediately and continue life long

questions.text: Superfecundation is fertilization of:

options.label: A
options.text: Two or more ova in same cycle from separate act of coitus

options.label: B
options.text: Two or more ova different cycle

options.label: C
options.text: Two or more ova same act of coitus

questions.correct_answer: A. Two or more ova in same cycle from separate act of coitus

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding hypothyroid disorder in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: The drug of choice in first trimester is propylthiouracil

options.label: B
options.text: The drug of choice in first trimester is carbimazole

options.label: C
options.text: Target TSH value is <2.5 mIU/L in first trimester

options.label: D
options.text: Most common cause is Iodine deficiency

questions.correct_answer: C. Target TSH value is <2.5 mIU/L in first trimester

questions.text: The ideal time of doing GBS screening in pregnancy is?
All the following statements are true about HCG except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is produced by trophoblastic tissue

options.label: B
options.text: It is responsible for hyperthyroid state in normal pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: It is responsible for vomiting in pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: B. It is responsible for hyperthyroid state in normal pregnancy

questions.text: The highest levels of prolactin are found during?

Which of the following is not true about the given procedure?

options.label: A
options.text: It is done for a case of singleton pregnancy with transverse lie

options.label: B
options.text: It should be done under general anaesthesia

options.label: C
options.text: Uterotonics are avoided before this procedure

options.label: D
options.text: Should not be done in previous scarred uterus

questions.correct_answer: A. It is done for a case of singleton pregnancy with transverse lie

questions.text: A 32 years old primigravida has severe mitral stenosis. She wants to continue pregnancy after knowing the risk. When is the ideal time of doing balloon valvotomy in this case?

Which one of the following is not a feature of APLA syndrome?
If a patient has an absent end diastolic flow in umbilical artery doppler in the third trimester, what should be the best plan of action in such case?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue pregnancy till 37 weeks and induce labour

options.label: B
options.text: Continue pregnancy till 34 weeks and induce labour

options.label: C
options.text: Continue pregnancy till 34 weeks and do cesarean section

options.label: D
options.text: Continue pregnancy till 32 weeks and do cesarean section

questions.correct_answer: C. Continue pregnancy till 34 weeks and do cesarean section

questions.text: During cesarean section, the following finding was seen. What must be the likely cause of this finding?

A pelvis has inlet contraction if the following things are seen except?

options.label: A
options.text: Obstetric conjugate is less than 10 cm

options.label: B
options.text: Diagonal conjugate is less than 11.5 cm

options.label: D
options.text: Transverse diameter is less than 12 cm

questions.correct_answer: C. Interspinous diameter is less than 8cm

questions.text: Which sign of pregnancy is due to asymmetric uterus caused by lateral implantation?

A 28 years old G2P1L1 with 38 weeks of gestation with previous LSCS done in view of fetal distress has gone in active labor with cephalic presentation. On PV examination, cervix is 7 cm dilated, 80% effaced, station is -3, diagonal conjugate is 10.5 cm. The expected fetal weight is 3 kg. She has a history of undergoing myomectomy for FIGO type 7 which was done 2 years back. What is your further line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Do emergency LSCS in view of myomectomy in past

options.label: C
options.text: Do emergency LSCS in view of contracted pelvis.

options.label: D
options.text: Conduct operative vaginal delivery by vacuum application.

questions.correct_answer: C. Do emergency LSCS in view of contracted pelvis.

questions.text: A multiparous patient has delivered a baby and during the third stage of labour the following condition occurred. Which of the following is not true regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: This is due to excessive traction on the umbilical cord

options.label: C
options.text: During the treatment of this condition, the fundus must be pushed inside and then the lower segment must be pushed inside

options.label: D
options.text: Uterotonic drugs must be given after the correction of the position

questions.correct_answer: C. During the treatment of this condition, the fundus must be pushed inside and then the lower segment must be pushed inside

questions.text: In the placenta, the structure responsible for remodeling of the maternal vessels to improve the perfusion is?

A patient underwent cordocentesis for Rh Isoimmunization. Which of the following is incorrect regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: FETAL MCA-PSV must be < 1.5 times MoM

options.label: B
options.text: Umbilical vein in punctured near placental end.

options.label: D
options.text: O negative packed cell transfusion is to be given irrespective of maternal and fetal blood group.

questions.correct_answer: A. FETAL MCA-PSV must be < 1.5 times MoM

questions.text: In a case of invasive mole, which one of the following is poor prognostic indicator?

options.label: C
options.text: Suction-evacuation was done 2 years back for molar pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: C. Suction-evacuation was done 2 years back for molar pregnancy

questions.text: A 27 years old primigravida is in labour, her gestation is 37 weeks, her pelvis is adequate. Vertex presentation is present, station is +2 with occiput at 3-o-clock position with fully dilated cervix and membranes are absent. There is maternal exhaustion and she is not able to bear-down. Which of the following is not correct option?

options.label: A
options.text: Oxytocin is given if contractions are inadequate

questions.correct_answer: C. Simpson’s forceps can be applied

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a contraindication for induction of labour by prostaglandin (PGE2)?

options.label: D
options.text: Reversal of umbilical arterial diastolic flow

questions.text: Which one the following pairs of condition and drug of choice does not match with each other?
questions.correct_answer: D. Treatment of atonic PPH – Carboprost

questions.text: Which of the following is not a part of AMTSL guideline by WHO?

Which of the following is not true about clinical pelvimetry?

options.label: A
options.text: Diagonal conjugate is evaluated for assessing the pelvic inlet

options.label: B
options.text: Funnel shaped cavity is seen in android pelvis

options.label: C
options.text: Anthropoid pelvis has transversely oval shape with transverse diameter greater than AP diameter

options.label: D
options.text: Sub-pubic arch is semi-circular in gynecoid pelvis

questions.correct_answer: C. Anthropoid pelvis has transversely oval shape with transverse diameter greater than AP diameter

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.correct_answer: C. Rubin’s criteria------------------------- Primary abdominal ectopic

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about intra hepatic cholestasis of pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: It is most commonly seen in the third trimester

options.label: B
options.text: Sr. Bile acids are highly increased

options.label: C
options.text: Delivery must be done at 39 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Most common symptom is itching in pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: C. Delivery must be done at 39 weeks

questions.text: A 28 years old primigravida has taken methotrexate for an unruptured ectopic pregnancy. After 2 days, she has come with generalised abdominal pain with pain at shoulder tip. Her pulse is 92/ min and BP is 110/70. What is the next line of management?
Simplified Bishop’s score is made up of?

options.label: A
options.text: Dilation, effacement and length of cervix

options.label: B
options.text: Dilation, effacement and station of the fetus

options.label: C
options.text: Dilation, length of cervix and station of the fetus

options.label: D
options.text: Dilation, cervical consistency and station of the fetus

questions.correct_answer: B. Dilation, effacement and station of the fetus

questions.text: Which of the following is seen in Rh incompatibility?

A 32 years old nulliparous patient has type 2 Dm. She is planning to conceive now. How much folic acid supplement must be given to her in order to prevent NTD in pregnancy?

A 27 years old G2P1L1 has 16 weeks of gestation. Her first pregnancy resulted in delivery of baby with Down’s syndrome. On doing karyotype of the patient and her partner, it was found that the patient had t (21,21) translocation abnormality. What is the next line of management in this case?
While doing NT scan, which of the following is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Average of the depths at different locations of translucency should be taken

options.label: C
options.text: Head of the fetus must be in the neutral position

options.label: D
options.text: NT of 3mm would require amniocentesis and karyotype

questions.correct_answer: C. Head of the fetus must be in the neutral position

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the given procedure?

options.label: A
options.text: Can be done in any trimester

options.label: B
options.text: Can be done cervically as well as abdominally

options.label: C
options.text: Fetal fibroblasts are sent for karyotype

questions.text: For the diagnosis of cervical incompetence, short cervix is defined as cervical length of less than how much?

Primigravida with 38 weeks of gestation has transverse lie in labour and FHR is 82 per minute. Cervical dilation is 3 cm and there is a prolapse of the umbilical cord outside cervix in vagina. Which of the following is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Manual disengagement is needed in transverse lie

options.label: C
options.text: Cesarean section must be done under general anaesthesia

options.label: D
options.text: Cesarean section must be done under spinal anaesthesia

questions.correct_answer: C. Cesarean section must be done under general anaesthesia

questions.text: Which of the following cardio respiratory condition would be a contraindication for continuing pregnancy?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in heart rate from baseline by 15 beats for 10 seconds

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in heart rate from baseline by 10 beats for 15 seconds

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase in heart rate from baseline by 10 beats for 10 seconds

options.text: It is not very efficient in getting the cells from the endocervical canal

options.label: C
options.text: It can be used to take endometrial sampling

options.label: D
options.text: The other end can be used for doing vaginal cytology

questions.correct_answer: C. It can be used to take endometrial sampling

questions.text: A 32 years old, multiparous patient has CIN1 on colpobiopsy. What is the next line of management?

options.label: C
options.text: Wait and watch (PAP+HPV screening for 2 yrs.)

questions.correct_answer: C. Wait and watch (PAP+HPV screening for 2 yrs.)

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the vaccine CERVAVAC?

options.label: A
options.text: It is for the females of age group 9 to 26 years

options.label: B
options.text: It protects from cervical, vaginal, vulval and anorectal cancer

options.label: C
options.text: It is given only by intra muscular route

questions.text: Which of the following is not a risk factor for the development of carcinoma of cervix?
A 32 years old multiparous patient has come to the OPD with post coital bleeding. There is no lesion seen on the cervix or vagina. What is the next line of management?
Which one of the USG finding in a patient of ovarian cyst is a marker of malignancy?

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased resistance in the doppler study

questions.correct_answer: C. Decreased resistance in the doppler study

questions.text: A 32 years old multiparous patient has an ovarian cyst which has Rokitansky protuberance. The size of the ovarian cyst is 6 cm. According to the ORAD system of classification, she is classified as?
Which one of the following is not a risk factor for endometrial cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: Granulosa cell tumour of the ovary

questions.text: A 62 years old patient has post-menopausal bleeding. Her endometrial sampling was done in OPD which revealed endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. What should be the next step?
Which one of the following presents as post-menstrual bleeding with persistent corpus luteal activity?
A 36 years old female has AUB with polymenorrhoea. Her USG is showing a 9 cm sized complex ovarian mass. Her estrogen, inhibin and AMH are highly raised. Which of the following is the likely cause?

options.label: C
options.text: Granulosa cell tumour of the ovary

questions.correct_answer: C. Granulosa cell tumour of the ovary

questions.text: Which one of the following is not treated by hysteroscopy?

options.label: A
options.text: FIGO type-4 fibroid with uterine size of 16 weeks

questions.text: A 27 years old nulligravida patient comes with lower abdominal pain, vaginal discharge. On examination she has adnexal tenderness and cervical motion tenderness. Her pregnancy test is negative. Which is the best treatment in this case?

A 22-year-old para 1 living 1, married since last 2 years comes with yellowish green frothy foul-smelling vaginal discharge. Her cervix and vagina are inflamed and red. Her partner is also suffering from intense itching and urethral discharge. Most common organism in this case would be-
A 20-year-old woman gives a history of sharp pain in the lower abdomen for 2-3 days every month approximately 2 weeks before the menses. The most probable etiology for her pain is:
The staging of Ovarian carcinoma is based upon which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: CT imaging of the abdomen & pelvis.

options.label: D
options.text: Surgical evaluation of the extent of intraabdominal diseases

questions.correct_answer: D. Surgical evaluation of the extent of intraabdominal diseases

questions.text: Regarding injectable progesterone contraception, all the following are true EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Medroxyprogesterone acetate is the most commonly used

options.label: D
options.text: Should not be given to lactating mother

questions.correct_answer: D. Should not be given to lactating mother

questions.text: A 27 years old patient has white discharge per vaginum and itching since last 2 months. She is also suffering from burning micturition. Wet mount examination reveals the following picture: What is an appropriate treatment?

A 32 years old patient PARA2 LIVING2 with no history of any contractive use or sterilization in past has come with abnormal uterine bleeding since last 3 months. She has spotting since last 3 months on and off. Which is the next line of management in this case?

A 47 years old patient has undergone vaginal hysterectomy with anterior colporrhaphy with posterior colpo-perineorrhaphy for UV prolapse 15 days back. She is now complaining of continuous wetness of genitalia. She is perceiving sensation of voiding urine and she is able to pass urine without and extra effort. She has no urgency, no nocturia, no dysuria but her frequency of micturition has reduced. Relatives are complaining of ammoniacal smell from her clothes. What must be the most probable diagnosis?
Identify the following instrument
According to FIGO, a fibroid which is intramural, touching the endometrium is classified as:

A 24 years old girl has secondary amenorrhoea, galactorrhea, infertility and on and off headache since last 4 months. Sr. prolactin level is 340ng/ml. MRI brain revels a pituitary tumour of 15mm. what is the next line of treatment?
A 29 years old, nulliparous patient of PCOS has come to the clinic for infertility since last 2 years. Her BMI is 22. Which is the drug of choice for ovulation induction?

A 36 years old patient has carcinoma of cervix which is diagnosed on colposcopy guided biopsy with the depth of stromal invasion of 2mm with no lympho-vascular stream invasion. She wants to conserve her fertility. Which is the best treatment for her?

options.label: C
options.text: Conization with laparoscopic removal of lymph nodes

questions.text: Which one of the following is not an indication of Methotrexate therapy?
Which of the following is not considered as male pseudo-hermaphroditism?
In a known case of endometrial carcinoma, which one of the following would suggest Type 1 endometrial cancer and hence good prognosis?
questions.correct_answer: A. Obese patient with estrogen excess

questions.text: A 17 years old girl had come with history of absence of menarche. Her height is 170cm. breast development is at TANNER stage 4 while axillary and pubic hair development is at TANNER 1. Which of the following should be the next step in investigations?
One of the following is not the use of this type of device?

options.label: D
options.text: Elderly with uterine prolapse, unfit for major surgery

questions.text: Which one of the following clinical findings does not match with the condition of endometriosis?

A 72 years old post-menopausal female is suffering from lump in abdomen. It is arising from the pelvis and it is hard in consistency and immobile. Her CA-125 is 2162 IU/L and USG doppler is suggestive of complex adnexal mass with increased vascularity. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

options.label: B
options.text: Sex cord stromal cancer of ovary

questions.text: Which of the following is not the cause of secondary dysmenorrhea?
Which of the following is an initial treatment for unexplained infertility?
Primary hypogonadism in male would have the following set of hormonal changes?

options.label: A
options.text: HIGH LH, HIGH FSH, LOW TESTOSTERONE

options.label: B
options.text: HIGH LH, LOW FSH AND LOW TESTOSTERONE

options.label: C
options.text: LOW LH, LOW FSH AND LOW TESTOSTERONE

options.label: D
options.text: LOW LH, LOW FSH AND HIGH TESTOSTERONE

questions.correct_answer: A. HIGH LH, HIGH FSH, LOW TESTOSTERONE

questions.text: Which one of the following is the screening test of congenital adrenal hyperplasia?
Which one of the following is not considered as estrogen-breakthrough bleeding?
Which of the following clinical conditions would not require gonadectomy as the treatment?
A 72 years old post-menopausal female is suffering from rectocoele. Which of the following anatomical structure is damaged?
What is the dose of ulipristal acetate as an emergency contraception?
Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to OCP usage?
The number of epithelial cells with irregular margins (clue cells) required for the diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis is?
Which one of the following is not included in specific criteria for diagnosis of PID as per CDC guideline?

options.label: D
options.text: Laparoscopy showing hyperemia and inflammation of fallopian tube

questions.correct_answer: A. C.Trachomatis or N.Gonorrhoea NAAT positive

questions.text: A 34 years old multiparous patient has developed invasive mole. Which one of the following would not be a marker of poor prognosis in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Interval between pregnancy and cancer was 2 months

questions.correct_answer: A. Interval between pregnancy and cancer was 2 months

questions.text: Patient with uterine cancer which was spread till the endocervical glands and serosa of the uterus. What is the stage of this cancer as per FIGO 2023 update?
Which of the following is true about COC pill usage?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the risk of PID

options.label: B
options.text: It increases the risk of vaginal candidiasis

options.label: C
options.text: It decreases the risk of cervical cancer

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the risk of ovarian cancer

questions.correct_answer: B. It increases the risk of vaginal candidiasis

questions.text: A 32 years old G2P1L1 patient with 19 weeks intra-uterine pregnancy developed acute pain in abdomen since last 2 hours. She had no such symptoms in the past. She has an 8cm sized FIGO-4 fibroid. Her temperature is 100.5o F. There is leucocytosis as well. What is the correct treatment plan in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Conservative management by analgesics, anti-pyretics and hydration

questions.correct_answer: A. Conservative management by analgesics, anti-pyretics and hydration
